pull.title: Avoid non-self-contained Windows header
pull.body:
Using the `windows.h` header guarantees correctness regardless of the content of other headers.

For more details, please refer to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4845198/fatal-error-no-target-architecture-in-visual-studio

Fixes the MSVC build when using the upcoming CMake-based build system and Qt packages installed via the vcpkg package manager.

Related to https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/pull/77.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

issue.title: cmake: Build `bitcoin-qt` executable
issue.body: A new configuration option `WITH_GUI` has been added. Its valid values are `AUTO`, `Qt5`, `OFF`.

events.body:
I don't disagree with using self-contained headers, but according to your link it should only be necessary if we don't define `WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN`, [which we do](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/configure.ac#L694).

So, this makes me think there must be some compilation units where this somehow doesn't get defined?

> So, this makes me think there must be some compilation units where this somehow doesn't get defined?

I suppose, they might be the `qt*` stuff built by vcpkg.

@theuni 

You might be interested to consider the following example: https://godbolt.org/z/b8rns1e6x

qt: Avoid non-self-contained Windows header

Using the `windows.h` header guarantees correctness regardless of the
content of other headers.
For more details, please refer to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4845198/fatal-error-no-target-architecture-in-visual-studio

Fixes the MSVC build when using the upcoming CMake-based build system
and Qt packages installed via the vcpkg package manager.

qt: Avoid non-self-contained Windows header

Using the `windows.h` header guarantees correctness regardless of the
content of other headers.
For more details, please refer to https://stackoverflow.com/questions/4845198/fatal-error-no-target-architecture-in-visual-studio

Fixes the MSVC build when using the upcoming CMake-based build system
and Qt packages installed via the vcpkg package manager.

events.body: ACK 8023640a71a10ec54a6a8e6b95a29d07f7be218d. It's not completely clear to me why this currently works, but I don't think it's worth wasting more time on. `windows.h` seems more correct regardless.

comments.body: Comment should be removed? We are removing these "for xyz" comments in any case, but this one would also now be incorrect.

> Comment should be removed?

Thanks! Done.
